page.title: 09GREAT BARDFIELD WINDMILL
page.content: The windmill in Great Bardfield is 3OO years old. It is a brick built tower with a boat shaped cap and common sails. The windmill was originally worked in conjunction with the watermill. When the water level dropped at the mill the windmill would be used instead for grinding the wheat, which was used for cattle feed. The present wall around the windmill is made from the original workings and cogs of the mill. The steps leading to the mill are made from the grinding stones. The workings for the sails are still in the cap even though the mill has been converted into a residential dwelling.
